intro: Colythrum febrifugum, commonly known as the feverfew plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dark green, lobed leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is known for its aromatic properties and has been traditionally used in herbal medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its historical use in treating fevers and headaches has contributed to its common name.
